origin: Late Middle English from Latin separat- ‘disjoined, divided’, from the verb separare, from se- ‘apart’ + parare ‘prepare’.

definitions.definition: Forming or viewed as a unit apart or by itself.
Cause to move or be apart.
definitions.example: police were trying to separate two rioting mobs

definitions.definition: Divide or cause to divide into constituent or distinct elements.
definitions.example: the milk had separated into curds and whey

definitions.definition: Make something form, or view something as, a unit apart or by itself.
Individual items of clothing, such as skirts, jackets, or pants, suitable for wearing in different combinations.
definitions.example: Day wear consists of angular shaped separates that include wide-neck jumpers and half-mast trousers.

definitions.definition: The self-contained, freestanding components of a sound-reproduction system.
Portions into which a soil, sediment, etc. can be sorted according to particle size, mineral composition, or other criteria.
definitions.example: analysis of mineral separates from six cordierite-bearing strata
